item.title: Deceptively Simple System of Equations
item.description: I’m currently taking Differential Equations, and I have never felt more mathy. That doesn’t mean I don’t occasionally get stuck on simple algebra. Consider these equations from a homework problem: $$ 2a_{2} + 3a_{1}x + 4a_{0} = 0 $$ $$ a_{2} + a_{1} + a_{0} = 1 $$ $$ \text{where } a_{0}, a_{1}, a_{2} \text{ are constants} $$ System of equations are introduced in high school, so I’ve solved tons of these problems before using the elimination technique (I don’t know any Linear Algebra yet).
